p: To determine the free radicals scavenging activity of P. armeniaca and P. domestica essential oils, 2,2’-diphenypicryl hydrazyl (DPPH) and 2,2’-azino-bis(3-ethylbenzothiazoline-6-sulphonic acid) (ABTS) tests were employed testing different essential oils concentrations in the range of 62.5–100 μg/mL and 25–400 μg/mL for DPPH and ABTS test, respectively [ 15]. Ascorbic acid was employed as positive control.
